page.title: 04NURSERIES
page.content: A significant change in the SW corner during the last five years. Orchards have been grubbed and the land returned to a wheat, barley, oil seed rape rotation. There are two Farm Shops, a Garden Centre and a Pick-Your-Own enterprise next to one of the Farm Shops. Three Dutch growers have recently developed specialist lettuce enterprises. One grows 20 hectares of outdoor Iceberg lettuce, at 25,000 plants per acre, at least 3 crops a year. He employs up to 25 people. A second grows only seedling lettuce under glass and the third specialises in glasshouse lettuce production generally. These Dutch growers are all young migrants who have settled in Sussex because of land quality and excellent light. Dutch land prices too high for them. They talk in acres!
